messages.content: How many people have been killed in Israel's latest assault on the Gaza Strip?
Since the start of Israel’s latest assault on the Gaza Strip, following Hamas's surprise attack on October 7, the Israeli military has killed more than 10,500 people.
Since the start of Israel’s latest assault on the Gaza Strip, following Hamas's surprise attack on October 7, its military has killed more than 10,500 people.
How many children have died in the conflict?
At least 4,300 of the 10,500 people killed are children.
Since the start of Israel’s latest assault on the Gaza Strip... at least 4,300 of whom are children.
How many targets has Israel struck from October 7 to November 1?
Israel says it has struck at least 12,000 targets across the Gaza Strip from October 7 to November 1.
Israel says it has struck at least 12,000 targets across the besieged Palestinian territory from October 7 to November 1.
What is the comparison of explosive power between Israel’s bombs dropped on Gaza and other powerful explosions?
Israel has dropped more than 25,000 tonnes of explosives on the Gaza Strip, equivalent to two nuclear bombs.
According to the Euro-Med Human Rights Monitor, Israel has dropped more than 25,000 tonnes of explosives on the Gaza Strip since October 7, equivalent to two nuclear bombs.
How many residential units have been damaged in Gaza?
Half of Gaza’s homes have been damaged, totaling about 222,000 residential units, with more than 40,000 completely destroyed.
Half of Gaza’s homes - 222,000 residential units damaged with more than 40,000 completely destroyed.
How many educational facilities have been damaged in the conflict?
278 educational facilities have been damaged in the bombing.
278 educational facilities damaged.
How many healthcare facilities have been attacked?
270 healthcare facilities have been attacked.
270 healthcare facilities attacked.
What is Jabalia and why is it significant?
Jabalia is one of the largest refugee camps in northern Gaza, housing about 116,000 registered refugees. The camp has been repeatedly hit by Israeli military attacks.
In the north of Gaza is one of the largest camps, Jabalia. The Israeli military has repeatedly hit the camp... killing several hundred people.
What did the Israeli military claim about the attacks on Jabalia on November 1?
The Israeli military claimed the attacks on Jabalia on November 1 had killed Hamas commander Ibrahim Biari, who played a pivotal role in the planning and execution of the October 7 attacks on Israel.
The Israeli military said that the attacks on Jabalia on November 1 had killed Hamas commander Ibrahim Biari...
How has the Israeli military defended their use of 'smart bombs' in Gaza?

Israel's military strategy with the use of 'smart bombs' is aimed at accurately targeting militant infrastructure to achieve military objectives, allegedly without attempting to limit civilian casualties and infrastructure damage.

Israel's use of ‘smart bombs’ in Gaza is part of a broader military strategy aimed at accurately targeting militant infrastructure to achieve military objectives, with no attempt to limit civilian casualties and infrastructure damage.
How many refugees live in Gaza?
Gaza is home to approximately 1.7 million refugees who were ethnically cleansed from areas now part of Israel.
Gaza is home to some 1.7 million refugees who were ethnically cleansed from areas that now form part of Israel.
How many places of worship have been damaged in Gaza?
69 places of worship have been damaged, including mosques and churches.
69 places of worship damaged, including mosques and churches.
What are the consequences of the Israeli bombardment on Gaza's infrastructure?
The Israeli bombardment has resulted in damage to homes, schools, healthcare facilities, places of worship, ambulances, bakeries, communication systems, and water treatment plants.

Satellite imagery and photographs show entire neighbourhoods have been levelled with many hospitals, schools, places of worship and homes damaged or destroyed by Israeli land, sea and air attacks. Entire communication systems and water treatment plants have also been disabled.
What has been reported about civilian casualties in the attacks on Jabalia camp?
Hamas’s armed wing, the Qassam Brigades, reported that seven civilian hostages were killed in the attack on the Jabalia camp, including three foreign passport holders.
Hamas’s armed wing, the Qassam Brigades, said seven civilian hostages were killed in the attack...
What was the reaction of a young Palestinian boy to the strikes on the Jabalia camp?
Following the strikes on the Jabalia camp, a young Palestinian boy described pulling a headless body from the rubble, while expressing distress over the targeting of shelters.
Following the strikes on the Jabalia camp, a young Palestinian boy described how he pulled a headless body from the rubble...
